message: idiots

Question every single expenditure from these folks at the Pentagon. They have an extraordinary record of wasting billions on a project that won't get used. I am disgusted with the whole bunch of them. They are being paid to enable projects like these. While it may be faster and unmanned, I seriously doubt if it's cheaper than anything else we're making. Bottom line is that we should NOT be making more war machines; we need to turn our attention toward the making of peaceful countries. War is not anachronous and threatens all of humanity and the future of the world. Having peace would save ALL countries a bundle. We need a Department of Peace that will put clamps on these criminal runaway budgets for more war toys. Someone needs to step and be an adult and tell the children to quit fighting. Bernie might just be that adult.

I would say British schools have a very high threshold for what is appropriate attire/hair-do and they seem to take pride in shaming children and their parents. I wonder if there is any study demonstrating that uniform rules do anything to combat bullying. What I know is that every now and then there is a news piece about a kid sent back home for failing to adhere to rules often interpreted ad lib and a host of cyber bullies ready to blame their parents for failing to understand the fine print of the school clothing mandates. It is troubling to me that everything the media seems to cover about the British educational system is apparel and hair style. And I find it peculiar that people tend to discuss whether the rules themselves are being properly applied instead of questioning their purpose and efficacy.
